definitions.definition: A structure built for commemorative or symbolic reasons, or as a memorial; a commemoration.
definitions.example: There is a monument on the town green to the soldiers who died in World War I.

definitions.definition: An important site owned by the community as a whole.
An important burial vault or tomb.
A surveying reference point marked by a permanently fixed marker (a survey monument).
A pile of stones left by a prospector to claim ownership of ore etc. found in a mine.
To mark or memorialize with a monument.
